Let’s get deeper by introducing SQL

Navigate back to your dashboard.

Our children’s safety is important. So let’s compare crimes and Boston Public Schools.

Same as before, right click and ‘copy’ this link for a Boston Public Schools dataset.

We want to find out how many crimes are occuring within 300 meters of each school.

sql UPDATE boston_public_schools_2012-2013 SET the_geom = ST_Buffer(the_geom::geography, 300)::geometry * Intro to what’s possible with SQL * Querys * multi-table manipulation * Analysis

Now, Let’s bring in our crime data from our datasets, and join our tables to get results!

  • Data table manipulation in the editor
  • creating rows and columns

sql UPDATE boston_public_schools_2012-2013 SET point_count = (SELECT count(*) FROM crime_incident_reports_thursday WHERE ST_Intersects(crime_incident_reports_thursday.the_geom, boston_public_schools_2012-2013.the_geom))
